text: The United States Senate Committee on Finance (or, less formally, Senate Finance Committee) is a standing committee of the United States Senate. The Committee focuses on issues relating to taxation and other revenue measures generally. It is considered to be one of the most powerful committees in Congress. ==Current members== Majority Minority * Ron Wyden, Oregon, Chairman * Debbie Stabenow, Michigan * Maria Cantwell, Washington * Bob Menendez, New Jersey * Tom Carper, Delaware * Ben Cardin, Maryland * Sherrod Brown, Ohio * Michael Bennet, Colorado * Bob Casey, Pennsylvania * Mark Warner, Virginia * Sheldon Whitehouse, Rhode Island * Maggie Hassan, New Hampshire * Catherine Cortez Masto, Nevada * Elizabeth Warren, Massachusetts * Mike Crapo, Idaho, Ranking Member * Chuck Grassley, Iowa * John Cornyn, Texas * John Thune, South Dakota * Richard Burr, North Carolina * Pat Toomey, Pennsylvania * Tim Scott, South Carolina * Bill Cassidy, Louisiana * James Lankford, Oklahoma * Steve Daines, Montana * Rob Portman, Ohio * Todd Young, Indiana * Ben Sasse, Nebraska * John Barrasso, Wyoming ==References== Finance
title: United States Senate Committee on Finance
